title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Ukraine

C. Stanford

D. The United Mine Workers

---

2. Hurricane Ida battered the New Orleans region. For which local lake were storm warnings issued?

A. Lake Success

B. Lake Como

C. Lake Maurepas

D. Lake St. Clair

---

3. Entrepreneur Donald B. Poynter, who died at 96, said one of his best ideas came while he was driving. What was it?

A. Whiskey-flavored toothpaste

B. Self-opening sardine cans

C. Heated toilet seats

D. Ventilated coffins

---

4. A new Texas law bars abortions if a fetal heartbeat is detectable. At about how many weeks into pregnancy does that usually occur?

A. 12

B. 8

C. 6

D. 4

---

5. North Korea appears to have resumed operation of its plutonium-producing reactor -- at what location?

A. Yongbyon

B. Nampo

C. Chongjin

D. Kusong

---

6. What did China just ban for young people?

A. Honor rolls

B. Aptitude tests

C. Online video games during the school week

D. Birth control

---

7. A California wildfire menaced South Lake Tahoe. What was the blaze called?

A. Caldor

B. Kress

C. Kresge

D. McCrory

---

8. Nkeki Obi-Melekwe narrates a new PBS series -- called what?

A. "A Climate Catastrophe"

B. "Plagues and Pandemics"

C. "The Youngest Continent"

D. "Future of Work"

---

9. A strike at the maker of Ritz and Oreos has grocers and snackers fretting. Who makes those classic snacks?

A. Nestle

B. Mondelez

C. Pepsico

D. Intel

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. C

3. A

4. C

5. A

6. C

7. A

8. D

9. B
